TITLE: Cramer: I think Trump will win his trade fight but it better happen quickly for investors
SUMMARY: CNBC's Jim Cramer says Trump needs to win his trade fight quickly because of slowing global growth.

TITLE: Cramer: Strength in tech and retail has 'masked' weakness in the broader market
SUMMARY: Stocks, particularly industrials, have been weak "since the peak in January" but nobody was really taking notice, he adds.

TITLE: Cramer: I have faith others can take charge at Intel after Brian Krzanich's ouster
SUMMARY: Jim Cramer says he was "stunned" by news that Brian Krzanich has resigned as Intel chairman and CEO.

TITLE: Cramer: US-China trade fight 'is not serious' right now; Trump has upper hand
SUMMARY: "The president is saying, 'You know what guys ... we got more staying power than you,'" CNBC's Jim Cramer says.

TITLE: Cramer: Elon Musk 'floats like a butterfly, stings like a bee' versus investors betting against Tesla
SUMMARY: Musk is "masterful" in the way he fights back against the short sellers of Tesla stock, CNBC's Jim Cramer says.

TITLE: Sen. Warren tells Cramer about her plan to make companies and CEOs more accountable to employees
SUMMARY: Corporate America is focusing too much on getting shareholders rich, so the government needs to intervene to hold businesses accountable, says Sen. Elizabeth Warren.

TITLE: If you invested $1,000 in Apple 10 years ago, here’s how much you’d have now
SUMMARY: On Thursday, Apple became the first publicly traded U.S. company to hit a $1 trillion market cap.

TITLE: Cramer: The only thing that can save the market is Powell changing course or Trump stopping tariffs
SUMMARY: Both Powell and Trump need to change course, but "neither is likely to occur," CNBC's Jim Cramer says.

TITLE: Disruptor 50 Roadshow takes Philly: transforming the economy and changing industries
SUMMARY: CNBC's Disruptor 50 Roadshow brings together founders, leaders and investors to discuss the challenges and opportunities available to entrepreneurs who are looking to accelerate their businesses.  A spin off of CNBC's Disruptor 50 list – which identifies 50 innovative companies every year – the roadshow will bring together Disruptor 50 company founders, leaders and investors to share actionable insights that can help you take your small business to the next level.

TITLE: Sports entrepreneur Michael Rubin sees 'nothing but growth opportunity in China'
SUMMARY: Jim Cramer sits down with Michael Rubin, CEO of Kynetic and executive chairman of Fanatics, to hear his take on the fate of business in China.

TITLE: Winning the $1 billion Mega Millions jackpot won't make you happier, but it will make you more satisfied, study finds
SUMMARY: Researchers analyzed the well-being of winners who collectively amassed $277 million and found some long-term benefits that run counter to common stereotypes about lottery winners.

TITLE: Cramer thinks the Federal Reserve is behind the sell-off: 'I really miss Janet Yellen'
SUMMARY: CNBC's Jim Cramer wants a Federal Reserve that can say it may be raising rates a little too fast, too much.

TITLE: Cramer: Don't buy Starbucks on Ackman's new investment
SUMMARY: Investors who buy Starbucks on the news of Bill Ackman's new stake "may end up being a little disappointed," Jim Cramer says.

TITLE: SoFi CEO Anthony Noto: Our loans 'have really strong risk controls'
SUMMARY: Jim Cramer and SoFi CEO Anthony Noto break down how the millennial-facing financial company is preparing for an environment with higher interest rates.

TITLE: Cramer says 'the housing sector's a disaster,' knocks the Fed as ignoring the data
SUMMARY: Jim Cramer warns that the housing sector is under pressure and says Federal Reserve officials are all but ignoring the damage.

TITLE: The Mega Millions jackpot is at a record-breaking $1.6 billion—here's what to do if you win
SUMMARY: Here's how to make the most of your good fortune.
